unitTitle: Unit 1: Exponents, Logarithms, Permutations and Combinations

items.title: Laws of Exponents
items.body:
• $x^n \times x^m = x^{n+m}$
  • $x^n \div x^m = x^{n-m}$
  • $(x^n)^m = x^{nm}$
  • $(xy)^n = x^n \times y^n$
  • $(x \div y)^n = x^n \div y^n$

items.title: Rational Exponents
items.body: $$ x^{\frac{m}{n}} = \sqrt[n]{x^m} = (\sqrt[n]{x})^m $$

items.title: Important Notes
items.body:
• If n is an **even** number, then x is a real **non-negative** number.
  • If n is an **odd** number, then x is a **real** number.

items.title: Repeated Multiplication
items.body:
• $x \times x \times ... \times x = x^n$ (where $x \in R, n \in Z+$)
  • $x^0 = 1$ (where $x \in R - \{0\}$)
  • $x^{-n} = \frac{1}{x^n}$ (where $x \in R - \{0\}$)

items.title: Rules of solving exponential equations
items.body:
• If $x^n = x^m$, then $n = m$.
  • If $x^n = y^n$, then:
    • $x = y$ (if n is odd)
    • $x = \pm y$ (if n is even)
    • $n = 0$ (if $x \neq y$)

items.title: Applications
items.body: This lesson focuses on solving complex exponential equations (e.g., quadratic forms like $49^x - 50 \times 7^x + 49 = 0$). Refer to solved examples in the book.

lessons.title: The logarithmic function and its relationship with exponential function

items.title: Logarithmic Function
items.body:
If $a \in R^+ - \{1\}$, where $y = \log_a x$ (logarithmic form), it can be converted to the exponential form:
$$ x = a^y $$

items.title: Notice that
items.body:
• There is no logarithm for a **negative number**.
  • There is no logarithm for **Zero**.

items.title: Key Properties
items.body:
1. $\log x + \log y = \log(xy)$
  2. $\log x - \log y = \log(\frac{x}{y})$
  3. $\log x^n = n \log x$
  4. $\log_x x = 1$
  5. $\log_x 1 = 0$

items.title: Change of Base & Inverse
items.body:
• **Base changing property:** $\log_y x = \frac{\log_n x}{\log_n y}$
  • **Multiplicative inverse:** $\log_y x = \frac{1}{\log_x y}$

items.title: Common Logarithm
items.body:
If the base is not mentioned, it is 10.
  • $\log 10 = 1$
  • $\log 100 = 2$
  • $\log 0.1 = -1$

items.title: Method 1: Equating Bases
items.body: If $\log_a x = \log_a y$, then $x = y$.

items.title: Method 2: Exponential Form
items.body: Convert logarithmic equation to exponential form ($y = \log_a x \rightarrow x = a^y$) to solve.

lessons.title: Solving exponential equations by using logarithms

items.title: Using Logarithms
items.body:
To solve equations where bases cannot be unified (e.g., $3^{5x-2} = 7^{x+1}$):
1. Take logarithm for both sides.
2. Apply power law ($ \log a^n = n \log a $).
3. Solve the resulting algebraic equation.

items.title: Fundamental Counting Principle
items.body:
If the number of ways to perform task 1 = m, task 2 = l, task 3 = n... then methods to perform them together:
$$ \text{Total Ways} = m \times l \times n \times ... $$

items.title: Factorial
items.body:
Factorial of a positive integer n (written as $n!$ or $\lfloor n$):
$$ n! = n(n-1)(n-2) \times ... \times 3 \times 2 \times 1 $$

items.title: Permutations ($nP_r$)
items.body:
Number of permutations of n distinct objects taken r at a time:
$$ ^nP_r = n(n-1)(n-2)...(n-r+1) $$
where $r \leq n, r \in N, n \in Z^+$.

items.title: Combinations ($nC_r$)
items.body: Number of combinations of r objects chosen from n elements ($^nC_r$).

items.title: Rules of Combinations
items.body:
• $^nC_r = \frac{^nP_r}{r!} = \frac{n!}{r!(n-r)!}$
  • If $^nC_x = ^nC_y$, then $x=y$ OR $x+y=n$.
  • Reducing Law: $^nC_r = ^nC_{n-r}$
  • $^nC_n = ^nC_0 = 1$
  • Ratio Law: $\frac{^nC_r}{^nC_{r-1}} = \frac{n-r+1}{r}$
